info.title: FlowKitUI Backend
info.description: A REST API for managing and postprocessing Flowkit data

tags.name: data
tags.description: Endpoints for getting data; used by the UI

tags.name: maintenance
tags.description: Endpoints for setting up flowkit-ui-backend; used by FlowKit

get.description: Checks whether the API is up and running
Gets a list of all data providers configured for this flowkit-ui-backend instance

201.description: Created: The resource has been added and is returned in the content part of this response.

get.description: Gets all available categories currently ingested in this flowkit-ui-backend instance

201.description: Created: The resource has been added and is returned in the content part of this response.

get.description: Gets all available indicators currently ingested in this flowkit-ui-backend instance

201.description: Created: The resource has been added and is returned in the content part of this response.

get.description: Gets all available indicators for the given category
Gets all available spatial resolutions currently ingested in this flowkit-ui-backend instance. This excludes the boundaries, which are typically quite large and should be retrieved individually.

201.description: Created: The resource has been added and is returned in the content part of this response.

200.description: OK: The resource exists and is returned in the content part of this response.

get.description: Gets all available spatial resolutions for a category but without the boundaries
Gets all available temporal resolutions currently ingested in this flowkit-ui-backend instance

201.description: Created: The resource has been added and is returned in the content part of this response.

200.description: OK: The resource exists and is returned in the content part of this response.

get.description: Gets all available temporal resolutions for this category
Gets information about a single user

200.description: OK: The user exists and their metadata is returned in the content part of this response.

get.description: Triggers a password reset for the user

204.description: OK: The password reset has been initiated and the suer should check their email for further instructions.

get.description: Get the current config for this flowkit-ui-backend server.

post.description: Set up the data storage using the data submitted in this request. Delete all existing data.

patch.description: Set up the data storage using the data submitted in this request. Update existing data where it exists.

post.description: Add data and metadata to the database.

patch.description: Add data and metadata to the database and overwrite if it exists.

x-skip-test.reason: This delete test is currently broken.

delete.description: Delete data and metadata from the database.

get.description: Retrieves a CSV serialisation of the requested data
Get the range of available temporal units for the given parameters

post.description: Run a query to get data from the database

x-skip-test.reason: This delete test is currently broken.

auth0.description: This API uses OAuth 2 with the authorisationCode flow.

scopes.profile: Read, edit and delete your account, profile and settings for this application

dataset.description: A combination of data and metadata, representing a new dataset to be added

scope_mapping.description: A mapping between scopes and metadata IDs to signify what a scope gives access to

heartbeat.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

config.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

data_providers.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

spatial_resolutions.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

temporal_resolutions.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

category.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

categories.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

indicator.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

indicators.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

csv.description: OK: The results for this request were retrieved successfully.

time_range.description: OK: The request was valid and the result is returned in the content part of this response.

query_result.description: OK: The data query was valid and the result is returned in the content part of this response.

created.description: Created: The resource was created successfully.

see_other.description: See other: The resource already exists and is returned in the response.

bad_request.description: Bad Request: The request is malformed, incomplete or otherwise invalid.

unauthorized.description: Unauthorized: The user does not have the permissions to access this resource.

not_found.description: Not Found: The requested data could not be found.

too_many_requests.description: Too Many Requests: The user has exceeded the limit of allowed simultaneous requests.

internal_server_error.description: Internal Server Error: Something went wrong on the server while retrieving the data.

service_unavailable.description: Service Unavailable: The server is currently down, e.g. for maintenance. Please try again later.

datetime.description: The date the heartbeat was created.

docker_image.description: The version number of the docker image. When semver is used, the version is stable.

git_branch.description: The current branch from which this build was created.

git_commit.description: The git commit from which this build was created.

git_tag.description: The git tag for this build. May be null or empty when untagged.

python_package.description: The name of the flowkit-ui-backend python package.

python_version.description: The version number the flowkit-ui-backend python package

data_provider.title: Data provider
data_provider.description: A data provider configured in the flowkit-ui-backend

dpid.description: The ID for this data provider

name.description: The name of the data provider

logo.description: The URL for a logo for this data provider

url.description: The URL of the data provider's website

data_providers.description: A wrapper object for data providers
A list of available data providers

language.title: Language
language.description: A language that is part of the metadata

code.description: The ISO 639-1 alpha-2 code for this language

name.description: The name of the data provider

flag.description: An emoji representing the flag for this langauage

default.description: Whether this is the default langauage

spatial_resolution.title: Spatial resolution
spatial_resolution.description: A spatial resolution available in flowkit-ui-backend

index.description: A numeric index placing this resolution in relation to other available resolutions

example.label: Department
example.description: In the administrative divisions of Haiti, the department is the first of four levels of government.

spatial_resolutions.description: A wrapper object for spatial resolutions
A list of available spatial resolutions

temporal_resolution.title: Temporal resolution
temporal_resolution.description: A temporal resolution available in flowkit-ui-backend

index.description: A numeric index placing this resolution in relation to other available resolutions

relativedelta_unit.description: The unit for the timedelta that this stemporal resolution represents

relativedelta_num.description: The number of timedelta units contained in one temporal unit at this resolution

date_format.description: The Python format to be used for temporal units at this resolution

default_selected.description: The number of time units to select by default for this temporal resolution

example.label: Month
example.description: A month represents a full calendar month for which the data has been aggregated.

temporal_resolutions.description: A wrapper object for temporal resolutions
A list of available temporal resolutions

type.description: TODO: should use data_type enum. The type of data. single_location for data that relates to only one spatial entity and flow for data that describes movement from one to another.

order.description: The order of categories in the UI

flowgeek_url.description: A link to a Flowgeek page with further information about this category

label.description: A human-readable label for this category

description.description: A description of this category, what it represents, how it is calculated etc.

category_id.description: The category ID this indicator belongs to

order.description: The order of indicators per category in the UI with the first one being the default indicator for each category

flowgeek_url.description: A link to a Flowgeek page with further information about this indicator

label.description: A human-readable label for this indicator

description.description: A description of this indicator, what it represents, how it is calculated etc.
description.example: This indicator represents the total number of residents for each spatial and temporal unit.

method.description: A longer explanation of the method used to calculate the indicator
method.example:
This indicator was calculated using the following method:
1. Some step
2. Another step
3. Final calculation

scale.description: The type of scale applicable to this indicator

decimals.description: The number of decimals to use when rendering the value. 0 decimals mean it will be shown as an integer.

min_value.description: The smallest value this indicator can have.

max_value.description: The largest value this indicator can have.

num_bins.description: The number of bins to render this indicator. If `bins` is specified, this will be ignored.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Metadata relating to the actual data

date_added.description: The date the dataset was ingested

category_id.description: The identifier for the category that this metadata relates to

indicator_id.description: The identifier for the indicator that this metadata relates to

srid.description: The identifier for the spatial resolution that this aggregate relates to

trid.description: The identifier for the temporal resolution that this aggregate relates to

dt.description: The date for the data this metadata refers to

min_value.description: The minimum value across all data associated with this metadata.

max_value.description: The maximum value across all data associated with this metadata.

single_location_data.title: Single location data
single_location_data.description: Data referring to exactly one spatial unit for one metadata instance

mdid.description: The ID of the metadata for this data

spatial_unit_id.description: The identifier for the single spatial unit that this data object relates to

flow_data.title: Flow data
flow_data.description: Data representing a flow between two spatial entities for one metadata instance

mdid.description: The ID of the metadata for this data

origin.description: The identifier for the origin spatial unit that this data object relates to

destination.description: The identifier for the destination spatial unit that this data object relates to

dataset.description: A combination of data and metadata to be ingested into the database

data_type.description: TODO: should use data_type enum. The type of data. single_location for data that relates to only one spatial entity and flow for data that describes movement from one to another.

data_input.description: Data to be ingested as part of this dataset.

data_type.description: TODO: not currently used. The data type. single_location is for data with one value per spatial unit whereas flow data has one value for a combination of two spatial units representing the direction of the flow.

datetime.description: A date plus optionally time formatted as one of the following: YYYY, YYYY-mm, YYYYwWW, YYYY-mm-dd, YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM or YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS

time_range.description: The range of available temporal units in data for a given combination of parameters

all_dates.description: An ordered list of all available time unit

min_value.description: The minimum value across all data in this time range.

max_value.description: The maximum value across all data in this time range.

csv.description: A CSV file containing data for one category, with some columns representing indicators. The content depends on the parameters.

user_metadata.description: Data we store about users on Auth0

preferred_language.description: The ISO 639-1 alpha-2 code of the user's preferred language; to be used in the UI

show_tutorial.description: Whether to show the tutorial to the user after they have signed in

roles_expiry.description: When this date is reached, any roles assigned to the user expire.

account_expiry.description: When this date is reached, the user account is marked for deletion at the next time the deletion job is run.

signup_cache.purpose: To help decide on placement of disaster response workers

signup_cache.description: The information a user can provide during signup

terms.description: Whether the user has accepted the terms and conditions

no_harm.description: Whether the user has agreed not do do any harm

privacy.description: Whether the user has accepted the privacy policy

marketing.description: Whether the user has accepted the privacy policy

example.purpose: To help decide on placement of disaster response workers

data_input.description: Data for the purpose of ingesting it into the database

spatial_unit_ids.description: An ordered list of identifiers for spatial unit(s) that this aggregate relates to. The number and ordering of this list is defined by the type of data that is being ingested.

indicator_id.description: An indicator ID that's unique across categories. To achieve this, it is prefixed by the category ID and a . character.

start_date.description: The first day to be included in the data

duration.description: The number of temporal aggregation units to be included

mdids_only.description: If true don't return data, only metadata IDs

query_result.description: The result for a query made through the API

min.description: The smallest value in the result set

max.description: The largest value in the result set

data_by_date.description: All data for the requested category, indicator, spatial- and temporal resolution and time range. The response is an object the structure of which depends on whether the result is for a single value or a flow. The keys are always dates, corresponding to the date format of the requested spatial resolution. The values are objects where the keys are spatial entity identifiers. In the first case, the values are numeric. In the second case, the values are objects where the keys are spatial entity identifiers representing the destination of the flow (as opposed to the origin in the outer identifier) and the values are numeric.

mdids.description: A set of metadata IDs representing the query result

config.description: A server configuration describing the data stored on the server

translation.description: Serialised JSON containing an object with optional translations for other properties of this object. The keys are the language codes and the values are dicts (original label/translated value).

min.description: The lower bound of the bin (included)

max.description: The upper bound of the bin (excluded)

width.description: The width of the arc if the bin is for a flow indicator as a percentage of the default.

scope_mapping.title: Scope mapping
scope_mapping.description: A mapping between scopes and metadata IDs to signify what a scope gives access to

scope.description: The scope ID as defined in the Auth0 security schema

mdid.description: The metadata ID that the scope gives access to
